title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: outlines propose change ssdsims.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: Please note ssdsims project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: Thanks using ssdsims! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal ssdsims facilitate simulation studies species sensitivity distribution data.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: library(ssdsims)  withr::with_seed(42, {   ssd_sim_data(ssddata::ccme_boron, nrow = c(6, 10), nsim = 2) |>     print() |>     ssd_fit_dists_sims() |>     print() |>     ssd_hc_sims(ci_method = c("multi_fixed", "weighted_samples")) }) #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>     sim stream replace  nrow data              #>   <int>  <int> <lgl>   <dbl> <list>            #> 1     1      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  #> 2     1      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> #> 3     2      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  #> 4     2      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> #> # A tibble: 4 × 6 #>     sim stream replace  nrow data              fits       #>   <int>  <int> <lgl>   <dbl> <list>            <list>     #> 1     1      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> #> 2     1      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> #> 3     2      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> #> 4     2      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> #> # A tibble: 8 × 8 #>     sim stream replace  nrow data              fits       ci_method     hc       #>   <int>  <int> <lgl>   <dbl> <list>            <list>     <chr>         <list>   #> 1     1      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> multi_fixed   <tibble> #> 2     1      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> weighted_sam… <tibble> #> 3     1      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> multi_fixed   <tibble> #> 4     1      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> weighted_sam… <tibble> #> 5     2      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> multi_fixed   <tibble> #> 6     2      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> weighted_sam… <tibble> #> 7     2      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> multi_fixed   <tibble> #> 8     2      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> weighted_sam… <tibble>  withr::with_seed(42, {   ssd_run_scenario(ssddata::ccme_boron, nrow = c(6, 10), ci_method = c("multi_fixed", "weighted_samples"), nsim = 2) }) #> # A tibble: 8 × 8 #>     sim stream replace  nrow data              fits       ci_method     hc       #>   <int>  <int> <lgl>   <dbl> <list>            <list>     <chr>         <list>   #> 1     1      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> multi_fixed   <tibble> #> 2     1      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> weighted_sam… <tibble> #> 3     1      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> multi_fixed   <tibble> #> 4     1      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> weighted_sam… <tibble> #> 5     2      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> multi_fixed   <tibble> #> 6     2      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> weighted_sam… <tibble> #> 7     2      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> multi_fixed   <tibble> #> 8     2      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> weighted_sam… <tibble>

title: Parameter Descriptions for Package — params
text: Default parameter descriptions may overridden individual functions.

title: Parameter Descriptions for Package — params
text: ... Unused. args named list argument values. ci flag specifying whether estimate confidence intervals (bootstrapping). ci_method character vector specifying method use estimating confidence limits. ssdtools::ssd_ci_methods() returns possible values. dist_sim character vector specifying distributions fitdists object ""`` distributions /"top"use distribution weight /"multi"` treat distributions single distribution. nrow numeric vector number rows generated data must 5 1,000, nsim count number data sets generate. pars named list parameter values. replace logical vector specifying whether sample replacement. seed integer starting seed NULL. start_sim count number simulation start . stream count stream number. .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar.

title: Parameter Descriptions for Package — params
text: flag non-missing logical scalar. string non-missing character scalar.

what: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_fit_dists_sims
title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_fit_dists_sims
text: Fit SSD Distributions Simulated Data

title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_fit_dists_sims
code: ssd_fit_dists_sims(   x,   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   ...,   rescale = FALSE,   computable = FALSE,   at_boundary_ok = TRUE,   min_pmix = list(ssdtools::ssd_min_pmix),   range_shape1 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   range_shape2 = range_shape1,   seed = NULL,   silent = TRUE,   .progress = FALSE )

title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_fit_dists_sims
text: x data frame sim stream integer columns list column data frames fit distributions . dists character vector distribution names. ... Additional arguments passed ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(). rescale flag specifying whether leave values unchanged (FALSE) rescale concentration values dividing geometric mean minimum maximum positive finite values (TRUE) string specifying whether leave values unchanged ("") rescale concentration values dividing geometric mean minimum maximum positive finite values ("geomean") logistically transform ("odds"). computable flag specifying whether return fits numerically computable standard errors. at_boundary_ok flag specifying whether model one parameters boundary considered converged (default = TRUE). min_pmix list one functions single argument inputs number rows data returns proportion 0 0.5. range_shape1 list numeric vectors length two lower upper bounds shape1 parameter. range_shape2 list numeric vectors length two lower upper bounds shape2 parameter. seed integer starting seed NULL. silent flag indicating whether fits fail silently. .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar.

title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_fit_dists_sims
text: x tibble list column fits fistdist objects.

what: Estimate hazard concentrations for multiple simulations using bootstrapping — ssd_hc_sims
title: Estimate hazard concentrations for multiple simulations using bootstrapping — ssd_hc_sims
text: Estimate hazard concentrations multiple simulations using bootstrapping

title: Estimate hazard concentrations for multiple simulations using bootstrapping — ssd_hc_sims
code: ssd_hc_sims(   x,   proportion = 0.05,   ...,   ci = FALSE,   nboot = 1000,   est_method = "multi",   ci_method = "weighted_samples",   parametric = TRUE,   seed = NULL,   save_to = NULL,   .progress = FALSE )

title: Estimate hazard concentrations for multiple simulations using bootstrapping — ssd_hc_sims
text: x data frame sim stream integer columns list column fitdists objects. proportion numeric vector proportion values estimate hazard concentrations . ... Additional arguments passed ssdtools::ssd_hc(). ci flag specifying whether estimate confidence intervals (bootstrapping). nboot count number bootstrap samples use estimate confidence limits. value 10,000 recommended official guidelines. est_method string specifying whether estimate directly model-averaged cumulative distribution function (est_method = 'multi') take arithmetic mean estimates individual cumulative distribution functions weighted AICc derived weights  (est_method = 'arithmetic') use geometric mean instead (est_method = 'geometric'). ci_method string specifying method use estimating standard error confidence limits bootstrap samples. default recommended value still ci_method = "weighted_samples" takes bootstrap samples distribution proportional AICc based weights calculates confidence limits (SE) single set. ci_method = "multi_fixed"  ci_method = "multi_free" generate bootstrap samples using model-averaged cumulative distribution function differ whether model weights fixed values original dataset re-estimated bootstrap sample dataset. value ci_method = "MACL" (ci_method = "weighted_arithmetic"), included historical reasons, takes weighted arithmetic mean confidence limits ci_method = GMACL takes weighted geometric mean confidence limits added completeness also recommended. values ci_method = "MAW1" ci_method = "MAW2" use two alternative equations Burnham Anderson (2002) model average weighted standard errors calculate confidence limits using Wald approach. values ci_method = "GMAW1" ci_method = "GMAW2" use equations previous two methods model average weighted standard errors geometric scale. Finally ci_method = "arithmetic_samples" ci_method = "geometric_samples" take weighted arithmetic geometric mean values bootstrap iteration across distributions calculate confidence limits (SE) single set samples. parametric flag specifying whether perform parametric bootstrapping opposed non-parametrically resampling original data replacement. seed integer starting seed NULL. save_to NULL string specifying directory save bootstrap datasets parameter estimates (successfully converged) . .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar.

title: Estimate hazard concentrations for multiple simulations using bootstrapping — ssd_hc_sims
text: x tibble list column hc data frames produced applying ssd_hc() fits.

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
text: Run Scenario

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
code: ssd_run_scenario(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   replace = FALSE,   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   rescale = FALSE,   computable = FALSE,   at_boundary_ok = TRUE,   min_pmix = list(ssdtools::ssd_min_pmix),   range_shape1 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   range_shape2 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   nboot = 1000,   est_method = "multi",   ci_method = "weighted_samples",   parametric = TRUE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'fitdists' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   dist_sim = "top",   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   rescale = FALSE,   computable = FALSE,   at_boundary_ok = TRUE,   min_pmix = list(ssdtools::ssd_min_pmix),   range_shape1 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   range_shape2 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   nboot = 1000,   est_method = "multi",   ci_method = "weighted_samples",   parametric = TRUE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'tmbfit' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   rescale = FALSE,   computable = FALSE,   at_boundary_ok = TRUE,   min_pmix = list(ssdtools::ssd_min_pmix),   range_shape1 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   range_shape2 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   nboot = 1000,   est_method = "multi",   ci_method = "weighted_samples",   parametric = TRUE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'character' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   args = list(),   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   rescale = FALSE,   computable = FALSE,   at_boundary_ok = TRUE,   min_pmix = list(ssdtools::ssd_min_pmix),   range_shape1 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   range_shape2 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   nboot = 1000,   est_method = "multi",   ci_method = "weighted_samples",   parametric = TRUE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class '`function`' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   args = list(),   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   rescale = FALSE,   computable = FALSE,   at_boundary_ok = TRUE,   min_pmix = list(ssdtools::ssd_min_pmix),   range_shape1 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   range_shape2 = list(c(0.05, 20)),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   nboot = 1000,   est_method = "multi",   ci_method = "weighted_samples",   parametric = TRUE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
text: x object use scenario. ... Unused. nrow positive whole number minimum number non-missing rows. replace logical vector specifying whether sample replacement. dists character vector distribution names. rescale flag specifying whether leave values unchanged (FALSE) rescale concentration values dividing geometric mean minimum maximum positive finite values (TRUE) string specifying whether leave values unchanged ("") rescale concentration values dividing geometric mean minimum maximum positive finite values ("geomean") logistically transform ("odds"). computable flag specifying whether return fits numerically computable standard errors. at_boundary_ok flag specifying whether model one parameters boundary considered converged (default = TRUE). min_pmix number 0 0.5 specifying minimum proportion mixture models. range_shape1 numeric vector length two lower upper bounds shape1 parameter. range_shape2 shape2 parameter. proportion numeric vector proportion values estimate hazard concentrations . ci flag specifying whether estimate confidence intervals (bootstrapping). nboot count number bootstrap samples use estimate confidence limits. value 10,000 recommended official guidelines. est_method string specifying whether estimate directly model-averaged cumulative distribution function (est_method = 'multi') take arithmetic mean estimates individual cumulative distribution functions weighted AICc derived weights  (est_method = 'arithmetic') use geometric mean instead (est_method = 'geometric'). ci_method string specifying method use estimating standard error confidence limits bootstrap samples. default recommended value still ci_method = "weighted_samples" takes bootstrap samples distribution proportional AICc based weights calculates confidence limits (SE) single set. ci_method = "multi_fixed"  ci_method = "multi_free" generate bootstrap samples using model-averaged cumulative distribution function differ whether model weights fixed values original dataset re-estimated bootstrap sample dataset. value ci_method = "MACL" (ci_method = "weighted_arithmetic"), included historical reasons, takes weighted arithmetic mean confidence limits ci_method = GMACL takes weighted geometric mean confidence limits added completeness also recommended. values ci_method = "MAW1" ci_method = "MAW2" use two alternative equations Burnham Anderson (2002) model average weighted standard errors calculate confidence limits using Wald approach. values ci_method = "GMAW1" ci_method = "GMAW2" use equations previous two methods model average weighted standard errors geometric scale. Finally ci_method = "arithmetic_samples" ci_method = "geometric_samples" take weighted arithmetic geometric mean values bootstrap iteration across distributions calculate confidence limits (SE) single set samples. parametric flag specifying whether perform parametric bootstrapping opposed non-parametrically resampling original data replacement. seed integer starting seed NULL. nsim count number data sets generate. stream count stream number. start_sim count number simulation start . .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar. dist_sim character vector specifying distributions fitdists object ""`` distributions /"top"use distribution weight /"multi"` treat distributions single distribution. args named list argument values.

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
text: tibble nested data sets.

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
text: ssd_run_scenario(data.frame): Run scenario using data.frame sample data ssd_run_scenario(fitdists): Run scenario using fitdists object generate data ssd_run_scenario(tmbfit): Run scenario using tmbfit object generate data ssd_run_scenario(character): Run scenario using name function generate sequence random numbers ssd_run_scenario(`function`): Run scenario data using function generate sequence random numbers

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
code: ssd_run_scenario(ssddata::ccme_boron, nsim = 2) #> # A tibble: 2 × 17 #>     sim stream  nrow replace data     rescale computable at_boundary_ok min_pmix #>   <int>  <int> <int> <lgl>   <list>   <lgl>   <lgl>      <lgl>          <list>   #> 1     1      1     6 FALSE   <tibble> FALSE   FALSE      TRUE           <fn>     #> 2     2      1     6 FALSE   <tibble> FALSE   FALSE      TRUE           <fn>     #> # A tibble: 6 × 17 #>     sim stream  nrow dist_sim data             rescale computable at_boundary_ok #>   <int>  <int> <int> <chr>    <list>           <lgl>   <lgl>      <lgl>          #> 1     1      1     6 lnorm    <tibble [6 × 1]> FALSE   FALSE      TRUE           #> 2     1      1     6 top      <tibble [6 × 1]> FALSE   FALSE      TRUE           #> 3     2      1     6 lnorm    <tibble [6 × 1]> FALSE   FALSE      TRUE           #> 4     2      1     6 top      <tibble [6 × 1]> FALSE   FALSE      TRUE           #> 5     3      1     6 lnorm    <tibble [6 × 1]> FALSE   FALSE      TRUE           #> 6     3      1     6 top      <tibble [6 × 1]> FALSE   FALSE      TRUE           #> # title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_sim_data
text: family functions generate tibble nested data sets.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_sim_data
code: ssd_sim_data(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' ssd_sim_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   replace = FALSE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'fitdists' ssd_sim_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   dist_sim = "top",   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'tmbfit' ssd_sim_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'character' ssd_sim_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   args = list(),   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class '`function`' ssd_sim_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   args = list(),   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )

Unused. nrow numeric vector number rows generated data must 5 1,000, replace logical vector specifying whether sample replacement. seed integer starting seed NULL. nsim count number data sets generate. stream count stream number. start_sim count number simulation start . .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar. dist_sim character vector specifying distributions fitdists object ""`` distributions /"top"use distribution weight /"multi"` treat distributions single distribution. args named list argument values.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_sim_data
code: ssd_sim_data(ssddata::ccme_boron, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow replace data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <lgl>   <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 FALSE   <tibble [5 × 5]> #> 2     2      1     5 FALSE   <tibble [5 × 5]> #> 3     3      1     5 FALSE   <tibble [5 × 5]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_sim_data(fit, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow args             data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <list>           <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_sim_data(fit[[1]], nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow args             data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <list>           <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]>  ssd_sim_data("rnorm", nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow args       data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <list>     <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]>  ssd_sim_data(ssdtools::ssd_rlnorm, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow args       data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <list>     <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]>

title: ssdsims 0.0.0.9001
text: Merge pull request #30 poissonconsulting/joethorley/issue21. Merge branch ‘main’ github.com:poissonconsulting/ssdsims. Pass … ssd_run_scenario(). Add .progress = FALSE argument. Add ci = FALSE argument. Merge pull request #22 poissonconsulting/fits. Merge pull request #20 poissonconsulting/fits. Add start_stream = 1L argument. Renamed skip start_seeds. Rename ssd_get_seeds() ssd_get_streams_seeds(). Merge branch ‘main’ seeds. Added ssd_get_seeds(). generate_data() vectorized nrow. Added ssd_generate_data().
